dlentry.dd: Normally it is used by the java executable that is found in the PATH environment variable. By using this variable, you can specify a different Java Virtual Machine installation directory.

You can specify a set of arguments for the Java Virtual Machine. The following example specifies the maximum and initial memory setting to be 300MB:SET JAVA_ARG_LINE=-Xmx300m -Xms300mSetting this environment variable disables the usage of the -Xmx parameter.
The path to one or more XML catalogs, in URI or File syntax. You can separate the catalogs by using the ":" or ";" symbols.

dd.note: See also the command line parameter. You can use it together with this environment variable.
